page.title: 14TRANSPORT IN BROUGHTY FERRY
page.content: Public transport is provided by bus and rail. Bus services extend from the centre of Dundee with inter-city bus routes passing close to the busy shopping area. In view of the large population travelling to the city, bus times are frequent and, in the main, satisfactory. The railway station is situated close to the shopping centre and provides links to the local and inter-city routes. {PRIVATE TRANSPORT}Cars and motor-bikes are used by commuters. Car-sharing is a popular economy measure. Roads are in good repair and traffic normally flows freely. {COMMERCIAL TRANSPORT}Light commercial vehicles carry goods to and from the shopping centres and small businesses. Larger lorries have difficulty negotiating the narrow streets here.
